Reviews.Title: “A very reliable and consistent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CliveTMexico
Reviews.Content: I find this Hotel to be very consistent in its excellent, well kept, clean and pleasant place to stay. The staff are well trained and appear very happy to be working there. After a hard day sunning on the beach or enjoying the vista's around the area it is a nice place to return to. The chef is very good and his speciality is one of my favorites..Arroz Mampostiao, which my wife and I usually have with other accompaniments for lunch. They pretty much have the monopoly on upscale Hotels in the area and it's nice to see that they maintain a very high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Large Clean Room at Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: savakirc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Aguadilla from February 6th through the 10th on a work related visit. The room was very spacious, clean and the internet service worked very well. The casino was located on-site, and had both slot machines and table games. The hotel is located near a few nice surfing beaches (wilderness, Ocean front, & Boat Wreck beach). I would recommend this hotel if you need to visit this area of PR.

Reviews.Title: “Very sterile”
Reviews.Author: leisuresusie
Reviews.Content: I realize this used to be a hospital but it still feels like one. The pool is strictly a "kiddie" pool. No ambiance. The restaurant is like a Denny's. The whole area will be skipped next time. Don't like staying on a military base.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of the room with no view”
Reviews.Author: Kelly H
Reviews.Content: To be fair, I like Marriott. I can feel confident that the beds will be good and the bedding clean. I currently have Marriott Gold so I was shocked when I checked in today to be given this tiny cramped dark hole and told it was my room. There was less than 5 feet between the wall and the bed on every side. The "window" was 5 feet up and had a view of a wall with chipped paint. I went back to the desk and requested a room with a view and was given a room that feels twice the size with a nice view of the pool. I am a little worried about the sound of the waterpark pouring all night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: maryanncr
Reviews.Content: Celebrated my sister's birthday at this hotel. Everything was so nice. Location, staff was very friendly, nice place to eat, rooms were excellent. Their casino was super, live band was outstanding. Then, so close to Ramey's golf course and Crash Boat Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Courtyard in an atypical building”
Reviews.Author: sbenus
Reviews.Content: I would ideally like to give it 3 1/2 stars, but since the rating system won't allow it, the hotel gets 3 stars due to my personal experience which many others probably won't have. The hotel is pretty much what you want from a Courtyard but it is in a building that used to be an old military hospital which means the room layouts (at least mine) are not optimal for a hotel. I am in a wheelchair and although I did not specify an accessible room, I have never before had issues with accessibility in the walking space around the bed but this time I could not move around the room at all. Luckily, I could get next to my bed since it was right beside the door. Since I was traveling with my father for just an overnight stay, it wasn't worth switching rooms. I had reserved a 2 bedroom suite and was a bit surprised by the layout. The 1st â€œbedroomâ€� doesn't have a door and is basically just an adjacent area to the sitting area. The 2nd room has a door (due to be old building, the doors were just wide enough for my chair but not by much) but is very long and narrow with 2 large comfortable beds. The ceilings are incredibly high and the windows are higher than normal which meant I could just barely see out of them, but couldn't look down. The bathroom was very small compared to other Courtyards I have stayed in. Admittedly, an able-bodied person shouldn't have my issues and would probably give the hotel a 4 out of 5. Other than the room, the staff were courteous and helpful. Check-in and check out went smoothly. We arrived late at night and the restaurant was closing but they let us in and served us. The club sandwich was good. The hotel's furnishing look almost brand-new, well-kept and pretty clean everywhere. The floor was a very nice tile. The Marriott bedding has always been one of my favorites and we slept very well in the comfortable beds. The lobby has a David's Cookies, business center, lounge area with television, and Wi-Fi. The casino is open 24/7 and had live music at the bar. We didn't play but just walked through to check it out. The location isn't the best for tourists but then again if you are staying here, it's probably for business, or some other reason other than leisure so it shouldn't affect you much. I would probably recommend the hotel to someone if they were looking for a place to stay in the specific town.

Reviews.Title: “Fun time”
Reviews.Author: Newporter2551
Reviews.Content: Did not need or want a room there ."..but the music and band and dancing and casino....were a BLAST.... Nice peeps too !!! Just Love PR

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and uncaring staff”
Reviews.Author: srbonilla
Reviews.Content: I had an early morning flight on December 31, 2011. The hotel was suitable because it was adjacent to the airport; however they had a wedding by the pool and the noise was so loud that it made it impossible for me to rest. On two occasions I requested a different room and to no avail. After I talked to one of the managers they offer me 50% discount that I never received.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD! Everywhere.”
Reviews.Author: ICUHEN
Reviews.Content: The place was generally nice but the building is not sound proof which wouldn't be too big of a deal if the pool hours were enforced and there wasn't a regional airport across the street! The food was a joke. There was one dining hall that looked like a Perkins. The other option is to eat at the casino bar where the food is equally atrocious and the bartenders are horrible. I stayed there on business for the Marriot points but next time I am in the Aguadilla area, I will stay at one of the small hotels in Jobos Beach instead.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zoraida A
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at the Marriot on 2010 & 2011. We enjoyed the Casino and the pool. The rooms are so sexy and confortable. We enjoy the stay. I recommend it. Eventhough my mother in law lives 10 minutes from the hotel, we really enjoy staying and the privacy. Mr. & Mrs. Luis Gonzalez

Reviews.Title: “(yawn), it's a Marriot”
Reviews.Author: ronbonbfhon
Reviews.Content: This place was very typical for a domestic US hotel, with a little latin flavor. The room was very spacious and comfortable, with a coffee maker and a safe. It has a nice hard wired internet access in the room, as well as WIFI, and computers in the lobby. Everywhere in the hotel was nice, and clean, and all the staff was pleasant and/or professional. I did not eat in the restaurant, too expensive. They have a small casino with a few table games (lost a fast 50 on craps, left). They casino will sell you a drink for a decent price. There is a nice little coffee bar in the lobby, a little pricey of course. My only real complaint is the price, $125 for a single room, allegedly holiday rate. They may try to get you to pay for parking, be sure to question that. There is a big pool area, kids will love it. If you want a cheaper room, EL Faro is right next door, with typical motel type rooms for $75. El faro actually has a nice tiki bar with decent food also. (The some ownership at both hotels)

Reviews.Title: “Mr. Ruiz... Take some notes !!!!”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: As a US Foreign Service Officer, I have stayed in millions of hotels. This hotel is located at a former US Air Force Base during the Cold War and this particular hotel was the Base Hospital during those days. The physical facilities are OK. In front of the Hotel we have a US Immigration and Customs Enforcement station. So security at the nearby hotel is a plus and the pool area is a blast for families with kids. However, Mr. Ruiz, ( Manager ) there are certain things to keep in mind. You have an unprofessional staff and is inefficient. No customer service at all. Some of them really couldnt care less. No personnel helping with your luggage, so you will have to carry your own bags to the room and the casino bar is useless. Our staff was very disappointed. You cannot run an hotel behind a desk. Get out and supervise your personnel. It seems like a tax shelter operation the way its run.

Reviews.Title: “Employers”
Reviews.Author: Veli_Pen
Reviews.Content: At evening when arrived i was walking around to grab a coffe and i saw this employees of DAvids cookies, Maintenance, front desk all at the same time in front of the lobby losing their time taking pictures, talking on the cell phone, lau ghing really loud and no one noticed that i was waiting to get a coffe i didnt bother to go there and asked to someone take care cause they were so busy they looked like little kids. Please this is a courtyard!! Not a play ground!! They guy of maintenace i had a chat with the guy of maintance that the letter start with a ,P and his breath smell like pure alcohol that was awful the lady from the coffe shop you can tell she hates working there with her attitude RUDE!. The Hotel its pretty and the food its great the casino wounderfull but it was an unforgettable experice please modify the quality of the employers they look so unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: us1087
Reviews.Content: This is a fine property in a Ramey/Aguadilla on the west coast of Puerto Rico. The immediate area of the hotel and nearby airport was once a US Air Force Base back in the Cold War. The property was turned over for civilian use years ago and the result is this fine little hotel in once what was the base hospital. The propert is easy to find and if you have ever been on a military base you get that feeling when you drive up to the hotel. Parking is free and check in was a breeze. Polite and friendly staff made a gringo from Florida feel right at home. They have limited food options (one sit down restaurant and a cookie stand) and the hotel market for snacks and sodas. The restaurant menu is not that great but does the job in a pinch. The service is lacking but thats more me and my impatience and not realizing that things take longer in PR. The lobby has free WIFI and the rooms have wired access. The pool is great for kids and there is a small casino off of the lobby area. Calling this a resort is a bit much but if you are in need of a clean place for a few days while taking in Western PR, this is the right place for you. My only complaint was that the air conditioner in the room was SO LOUD. It was right next to the bed and it sounded like a truck all night long.

Reviews.Title: “A Family gateaway”
Reviews.Author: Joselinramos2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel called Courtyard by Marriott in Ramey in a town called Aguadilla in the northwestern side of Puerto Rico (this town used to be my home town 10 years ago). I stayed with my wife and three kids for a long weekend out of the city. The weekend that we stayed some clubs around the area had live music (rock bands), craft beers and a surf contest in the near beach called Jobos. The rooms of the hotel was neat, the room service was nice, the service in the hotel restaurant was nice but slow and the food was great (we had brunch). The facilities of the hotel (bar, lobby,casino, etc...) was neat and I love their tranquil environment. The hotel has a small water park pool and our kids had fun. Aguadilla is a medium size town in the northwestern side of Puerto Rico. We enjoyed the beaches near the hotel, the surfing dinning places like El Carey, the draft beers in multiple locations, live music and a great safe environment. For our kids this town have plenty of entertainment: ice skating park, a water park called Las Cascadas, a skate park and many other amenities. The only down side was the hotel customer service by the staff in the lobby (counter); we ask for towels for the pool and took forever; their response to our questions was not nice (during the day; the night shift was nice). This was the only downside of this hotel, the price was average and the environment of the hotel is great for couples and great for kids. We have fun and we will back.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Marriot”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: Awesome beds, good casino, had to travel a little ways for quality local restaurants but well worth it. Courteous staff, small Starbucks downstairs. It's not an amazing hotel, but its not a bad hotel by any means. It's your basic Marriot, they're all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: jl21Va
Reviews.Content: I just stayed one night while passing through the area, but when I checked in an heard about all the amenities, I wished I was staying longer. The pool area was nice. There were apparently also restaurants (which looked nice), a bar area, casino and gym. My room was clean and comfortable. My only complaint was that even on the third floor I could still hear music from the bar later into the night that I would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service and will recommend to friends & co-workers”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence D
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were quick and helpful with the questions I had. The room was clean and was kept up every day. Even though the hotel was not in a major city, the town had beautiful beaches. My co-workers guided me to three or four local restaurants and recommened different Puerto-rican food and I absolutely loved the food. I must say that the locals were very warm and hospitable people. The bartender at the Marriott, Joy Gutierrez was an exceptional bartender. She was very pleasent, warm and friendly. She helped me enjoy my time showing a genuine interest in my questions and I noticed that she was very pleasent and positive to all of her customers. SInce I was traveling alone, she made it feel like I knew somebody there and I would definetly stay and/or recommend my friends/co-workers tot his hotel. I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Carrasquillom
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel in the West of Puerto Rico. It is close to the Aguadilla airport and near the best beaches in Puerto Rico. You can felt save in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to my next visit.”
Reviews.Author: 7Lex7
Reviews.Content: My first visit to marriott Agudilla, the staff was very warm and welcoming and were able to adress all my needs. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Great enviroment for families or single. The location to the airport is a plus and is in walking distance to a shopping center. My stay was a most enjoyable one and will return in the future. Thank you Courtyard Agudilla for a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel...FUN pool.”
Reviews.Author: CarlosERG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very kept. The restaurant serves a good breakfast and I hear lunch and dinner are better. The rooms are nicely furnished and decorated. We stayed in a suite, so the kids slept outside in the roll-out bed and crib, and we had the king bed to ourselves. Two TVs, fridge and a couple of comfy chairs. But the great draw for families is the pool. It's divided in two...one for kids which is less than 2 feet deep with cool water slides, cannons and buckets spilling water all over. The hotel also has a casino, WiFi plus PCs in the lobby, a lobby cafe, a gym and a game room. The hotel lacks a gift shop, a poolside bar (which it has but it's not operating) and a better towel service at the pool (including better towels). We used the pool in the afternoons after long days visiting local beaches. Great to wind down. One more peeve...suites with roll-out beds should be stocked with extra pillows, sheets and a blanket. There is plenty of closet space to store them. This way you don't have to wait for maid service at 10pm when your kid is dozing off ready to crash for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Courtyard I've been”
Reviews.Author: luvhpux
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week for business, totally agree with some of the previous comments here. 1. Arrived with a luggage and a big computer box, waiting for 15 mins to get assistance, none available. I had to hauled my luggage and the box myself to the room. 2. The girl at the counter didn't speak good English. Being 6'5", I was worried I was getting a queen/small bed so I asked 3 times if I was getting a King bed, she said I was getting a premier room, 3 times. 3. As you know, this is a converted Military hospital, the decor is descent, bathroom is small but the worst thing is, the AC is probably from the 70s. SUPER LOUD and next to the bed. On most nights, I pumped up the AC before I went to bed and hurry up and slept while the room was still cool, but quiet. I ended up waking up sweaty in the morning and turned on the AC again around 3am. 4. One day, coming back from work, I saw a plastic (laundry) bag hanging on my door handle, it's a bunch of clean towels. As I went in the bathroom, it turned out that the towel rack is missing a few towels. So, am I supposed to help them hanging those towels I got at the door? This is definitely not up to Marriott's standard. Luckily, I don't think I'm coming back here (to Aguadilla) ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back to this hotel. Service very poor.”
Reviews.Author: Jetdriver01
Reviews.Content: Service standards have been declining at this hotel since its opening. We have stayed at this hotel several times and service has gone downhill fast. With very few notable exceptions the hotel staff is ill-mannered and trained, and have a huge attitude problem when dealing with guests. No one seems to have undergone customer service training at all. The front desk clerks will leave you talking in mid-sentence and move away to either pick up the phone or speak to other customers or answer back with attitude to any of your concerns. The Guest Services line is a joke. Housekeeping did not make up the room and it took 3 calls to the front desk to get fresh towel, which, by the way have not arrived 1 hr later. The restaurant food is OK, however, service is very slow and waiters are not properly trained to do their job. We spent over 50 minutes waiting for appetizers and a further 45 to get the food. If you are staying in the Aguadilla area, this may be your only choice until something better comes along. I will spend my money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: captainmarigold
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the least bit a place to stay if you are a business professional! The service was below par in all ways. One example I can give is that I was put on hold repetedly while trying to speak with the front desk to shorten my stay by one day. I spent the good part of an hour on hold. As soon as the front desk would pick up again- they would put me on hold. Each time I was on hold it was for 10 to 15 minute increments. Absolutely unacceptable! This is only on example of the terrible service I received.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: docchilie
Reviews.Content: I didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel. I was there for two nights for business in nearby Montana. The room was clean with no bedbugs as for 1/18/11. Pool looks like it would be a blast for families with kids. Casino looks fun if you are into that, but the bar attached to it is useless as all you have to look at is a noisy casino. The restaurant is fair at best, but you don't have a lot of options within walking distance nearby, as others have mentioned. Just to the North (literally stumbling distance) of the hotel is another hotel called El Faro (the lighthouse) and is owned by the same people as this hotel. There is an outdoor bar/restaurant here that has good food, excellent drinks, and a great staff that speaks English. If it were not for the existence of this nearby bar, my stay would have been far less enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, above expectations in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: b25pilot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights while visting relatives in San German, it is about thirty to forty-five minutes away, but worth it. The room was clean, the staff excellent, but they charge $8.00 per day for parking in a "secure lot". There is a splash park for kids at the pool, it was never on, but after a request at the front desk it was turned on in about ten minutes. My daughter loved it. There is a casino/bar in the hotel that was not noticable from our room. The room had two queens as described, a flat screen HDTV, no refrigarator or microwave (never asked). The onsite restuarant was price for breakfast ($12.95 buffet) but we found descent breakfast less than 2-miles away. We did have Mofongo and Shrimp which was excellent. There are two great beaches near by Crash Boat Beach (Public Beach) and Shack Beach which has limited parking. Shacks beach had great snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the area for weekend family getaway”
Reviews.Author: PR_Vacation_Reviews
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel beacause we wanted a place to stay while visitng some attractions located in the island west area and to do some Geocaching. We got a last minute weekend deal for Puerto Rico residents $99/night/room +tax. The hotel looks like new and is nicely decorated. Front desk reception and service during our stay was excellent. Did not see any personnel helping with luggage, so you will have to carry your own bags to the room. They had carriages available for the guests use. We got a 1st floor room. It was clean, average size, nice flat screen TV, very confy beds. Notice that the room walls are very thin so we could clearly hear our neighboors. This was not a problem this time but could be for other people. Cheap thin towels in the bathroom. We had a not so beatiful window view to the neighborhood so we had the curtains closed during the whole stay. Pool: Well, this is this hotel lucky charm, the kids pool with the playground. Our kid loved it!!! The water was clean and there were lots of chairs and umbrellas around the pool. I used my own pool towels because the ones provided by the hotel looked old and over used. The casino and bar had live music at night. We did not enter that area because children are not allowed in there but from the outside you could see that people were having a good time. In general this is an excellent hotel for a short stay in the west area of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pool for kids, splish splash...”
Reviews.Author: VACATIONMERMAID
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last year for the month of July with my grandaughters and they had a blast they did not want to get out of the pool. the small waterpark in the pool was the magic of the trip. I was a bit dissappointed with the front desk because they had no one to assist with our eight pieces of luggage the bellboy was on lunch. As for the room it was nice and clean the beds were very comfortable, although I only stayed for a few nites. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone it was very peaceful. The pools were open until about 10 pm and that was a plus when its hot at nite and you want to swimm a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Marriott property”
Reviews.Author: Schnetzfink
Reviews.Content: What I liked * New (only a few years old) and generally in good shape (except for the plumbing) * Bed & pillows * Free in-room internet access What I didn't like * One morning between 6am and 7am, there was no water in sink or shower. Staff simply stated the pumps are being repaired, but really couldn't care less. No apology, etc. I couldn't wait for repairs to be completed and had to go to work unwashed. Big minus! * Noisy, somewhat older a/c units in room. There is the option to sleep with open bathroom window, but for some, this will be too hot and humid. * Restaurant food quality was underwhelming and there is nothing appealing nearby * Charge $8/night for parking. Understandable in a downtown location, but this property is pretty much in the middle of nowhere (albeit in a built-up area).

Reviews.Title: “It's a clean place...but it's in Aguadilla”
Reviews.Author: DSXM
Reviews.Content: My spouse had some business in Aguadilla, so we had to abandon the the comfort of San Juan for the unfamiliar surroundings of Aguadilla. It wasn't too hard to get from San Juan to Aguadilla, but once in Aguadilla, it was a little tough to find the hotel due to road construction and some closures, but we managed to make it unscathed. When we checked in the front desk clerk agreed to give us late check-out, however failed to do anything with that information as our keys were deactivated an hour earlier than we had requested to leave and we even got a call from the front desk asking if we were extending our stay. Anyhow, we didn't want to eat dinner in the hotel restaurant, so we attempted to venture out. There was a rundown shopping center with a pizzeria, deli, and Chinese take-out around the corner, so we opted for the pizza. There was nothing else to do in the area, so we went back to the hotel, went to the bar and went to sleep. Sleep was difficult with the loud wall unit air conditioning and the very allergenic feather pillows. The pool and the casino looked nice but we didn't really take advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: wepagirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Dec. 17 to Dec. 22, 2009. We arrived late, after 12 midnight and immediately asked if they had received our request for foam pillows instead of the feather (allergy issues). They advised us to check the room and call front desk if the pillows were not there. We arrived at our room #306 in the main building. No foam pillows. Called the front desk , they said "we'll get in touch with housekeeping". Well, we are still waiting for the pillows. The room was modern and very clean and overlooking the pool. Flat screen TV but no wireless internet. Have to be wired in the rooms. It is free though so that was a plus. A few pet peeves that I agree with other reviewers is the fact that they only give you 2 bath towels and a couple of smaller towels. Also, there are no mirrors in the room except for the two in the bathroom. Therefore, you have to wait for the other person to finish if you want to put on make up or comb your hair. Very annoying. One more thing, no coffee maker! They have a coffee bar in the lobby that is overpriced and you are forced to buy coffee from them because there is no other place nearby to get coffee. The cappuccino is actually good but not worth the money. It was low season so the hotel was not full. Good for us because we heard it is a nightmare in the summer. The casino is empty during the day but gets more traffic at night. Live music from Wed. to Sunday. You have to pay for parking ($8 per night). If you play at the casino you can get you ticket validated for free parking if you're just visiting. The pool is clean and was empty most of the time we were there except for Monday when we were awaken by loud Reggaeton music. At first we thought the staff was testing the equipment because why would anyone have music playing that loud at 9:00 a.m. in the morning!!! But, we were wrong. There was actually about 100 teenage girls in the pool area! Apparently, they had rented the pool for the day and paid for a DJ to liven up the place. We left the hotel that morning and came back around 3 p.m. Thankfully all was quiet by then and we were able to enjoy the pool again. We have to say that given what is available in the area in terms of hotels, this is probably your best bet but it's definitely overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and nice. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Stringbean57
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and had a relaxing night stay at the Courtyard Marriott in Aguadilla. The staff was very helpful and the room was very clean and comfortable. Not many places to eat nearby other than the hotelâ€™s restaurant but about 2 blocks away we found a very good pizza place. Very nice pool for younger kids. I stayed here because I had Marriott points. It was about 2 hours from San Juan. If I was in the area again, I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “never I'd go to the old hospital for fun”
Reviews.Author: gringo65
Reviews.Content: this was a return home for me to show my wife all the stories were true. I lived here in the sixties and my high school is now a flea market

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: SunFunSun
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights as it is near to the town he is from and we were attending his mom's funeral. We come to the area fairly regularly and this was our first stay at this property and will mostly likely be our usual place as long as they stay as good as they are now. Maintenance in the public areas is great, but I'm worried Housekeeping might not keep the rooms up to make them last. FYI, I am a picky traveler. I need clean and I need functional and I need friendly staff. This came through pretty well. The property is very nice and modern. If you have kids, the pool is awesome and fun. Not sure I could handle being out there myself with the screaming that comes from the fun though. Property has a small, but nice casino too which I didn't know. We didn't go in, but will on our next more pleasurable visit. The lounge was empty when we were there each night, but I didn't mind. Music was great in the background. Staff was great AND entertaining! Food was very good and priced as you'd expect a hotel lounge to be. They had a nice variety of local food and trusted stand by's (burger, pizza) for us less adventuous eaters. Room was very comfortable and a good size. My few problems with the room were: Only 2 sets of towels. We would ask for more, but had to do that each day as they never replaced just what housekeeping took, they only left 2 sets again. Towels were very thin too, so don't know how long they will last. Also, housekeeping was not the best in the bathroom. The bathroom had a large floor area, but not sink area. There was one sink (a very nice sink too) with essentially no counter, though there were two small wall shelves we used for our stuff and kept the toilet lid down so nothing fell in. The mirrow over the sink is only big enough for one person at a time. The only other mirror in the room is a full-length inside the bathroom door. This made it very hard for two people to get ready at the same time and being we were on a schedule each day, this was a problem. I don't care to put my makeup on in a steamy bathroom when my hubby is shaving. Despite these things, we loved the place. Will just bring a small makeup mirror next time with me and that should do the trick. (We are booked to go back next month already!) Certainly, this is the best hotel in Aguadilla. Having a shuttle to the airport is great too! Not sure why they have to charge guests for parking. I think they should leave that for the non-guest casino-goers. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the memories”
Reviews.Author: NativeTexan35
Reviews.Content: This is intended to say how much my husband and I appreciate what Senior Jesus Ruiz has done for all the Military Families that call Ramey AFB home for all those years. I was very touched by what this man has done to help keep fond memories alive. Our youngest son was born there on July 22, 1962. This was a stroll down memory lane for us. Thank you sir, and I hope that you have received many more notes from many of us.

Reviews.Title: “3 star only because it's fairly new...”
Reviews.Author: MissDivaD
Reviews.Content: Very close to the airport, although shuttle service was extremely slow.We were scheduled to stay two nights, I was ready to leave after the first.The hotel looks new, but the staff is inefficient. Requested a fridge for the room, he stated he would call me...still waiting.The bathroom only had large bath towels.No hand or wash towels..(is this the norm?)I know at least in the U.K. you get a hand towel! There was this stale smell in the hallways and my room.I think because of the amount of guests and the rooms can't be aired out...the windows have locks on them.I guess to keep small children from falling out. The beds were a little too soft for me and the pillows were large but flat.The water pressure was great but the temp never really got hot...either conservation idea or just bad plumbing. My room was at the end of the 3rd floor hallway and faced a school.I was awakened by the yells and squeals of teen girls.I was young once too, but I still prefer not to have my room facing the entrance to a middle school. There is NOTHING around this hotel, so rent a car.There are nice sites to visit but you can't walk to them. I wouldn't visit Aguadilla again and if I did I would select not to stay at the CY Aguadilla.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms great pool”
Reviews.Author: ContinentalFA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand spanking new. The front desk staff was fairly nice, but didn't go out of their way to be friendly. The casino was not yet open, but looked rather small. The rooms were very comfortable, a/c worked great, nice large bathrooms, all very clean. The mattress and bedding was so nice and soft...made for a very good night sleep. The pool is large and very nice, excpet there are kids running around all over the place. Had dinner at the hotel restaurant. The restaurant staff were extremly friendly, and the service was outstanding. The prices however, are a bit steep. Overall, this is a pretty nice hotel. I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Dygason
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband and kids to stay for three days. The hotel employees make you feel at home. Everything was clean and neat. It was the first hotel experience for my kids and it went perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people at Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: MarkLChicago
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Courtyard for 2 weeks. The most impressive thing, was that everyone that works there, treats you like they own it. Outstanding service from the front desk, coffee shop (great treats and coffee) to the restaurant staff and houskeeping. The rooms are clean and bedding is very comfortable. Be aware that if you get the 2 bedroom suite, the one bedrrom with the king size bed does not have a door to the room. If you are looking for privacy, this may be a problem. The other bedroom has 2 queen beds with a door. They could maybe do a little better job of cleaning the pool area after late night, as they where nights where people are sitting out near the pool drinking and enjoy the wonder evening, but in the morning, I sometimes found cigarette butts on the beautiful patio. Also the casino was not open, and this was one of the reason I booked this hotel. This hotel will be a hot spot when the casino opens. I have written a letter to Marriott about this, but have not recevied a response from Marriott corporate yet :(. This is nothing against this hotel, but Marriott Corporate. I would stay here again because of the staff. They also have security 24/7 and you would feel very safe here.
